level.heading: Transfer; assignment; assumption of other powers; duties.
Temporary Amendment of Section
level.text: For temporary (225 day) amendment of section, see § 2 of the National Capital Revitalization Corporation Temporary Amendment Act of 2001 (D.C. Law 14-53, Dec. 6, 2001, law notification 48 DCR 10807).

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 2 of National Capital Revitalization Corporation Emergency Amendment Act of 2001 (D.C. Act 14-114, August 3, 2001, 48 DCR 7649).

For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 2 of National Capital Revitalization Corporation Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2001 (D.C. Act 14-140, October 23, 2001, 48 DCR 9934).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 12-144
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 12-144, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 2-1219.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 12-288
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 12-288, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 2-1219.03.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 14-188
level.text: Law 14-188, the "RLA Revitalization Corporation Amendment Act of 2002", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 14-401, which was referred to the Committee on Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 7, 2002, and June 4, 2002, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 25, 2002, it was assigned Act No. 14-398 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 14-188 became effective on October 1, 2002.

level.heading: Effective Dates
level.text: Section 33(b)(1) of D.C. Law 12-144 provided that § 30(a)(1) subsec. (a)(1) of this section shall take effect on the latter of: (A) September 11, 1998; or (B) the Dates determined by the Board, but not later than one year after the initial meeting of the Board.

Section 33(b)(2) of D.C. Law 12-144 provided that § 30(b)(1) subsec. (b)(1) of this section shall take effect on the latter of: (A) September 11, 1998; or (B) the Dates determined by the Board, but not later than one year after the initial meeting of the Board.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Section 2(b)(3)(B) of D.C. Law 14-188 provided that the repeal of subsec. (d) shall apply as of September 11, 1998.
